> <OLD>
>
> As he went over towards the..  Rising architecture in the region, WHEELIE
> simply had nowhere else to go.  Finding his way out of the communications
> blockade would take too long, and even then the Maximals going into it would
> be scattered.  Such a signal could easily be faked by anyone with
> commuincations gear, and whatever it was was almost guaranteed to be a decoy
> or a trap, not a dropped Autobot.  Such things were a tactic as old as
> communications warfare existed.
>
> But he simply had nothing else to go on.  For the moment, as he zoomed along
> the road slowly, the dust and mud from the jungle and the clearing foilage
> still obscuring him somewhat as he went along the tracks, he had no other
> leads.  HE could not pick up anything on sensors, he was not a good enough
> technician to try and backtrack along the signal or try and bypass it, adnh
> the foliage of the jungle was far too thick for him to attempt any sort of
> scans regardless.
>
> So, he could not do anything but drive towards it, cautiously as he could,
> keeping his scanners set to passive and running along primarily on visual
> and auditory scanners.
>
> At this point, he did not know whether the approaching structure was
> something made by the natives of thi splanet in time, or would be something
> of clearly alien manufacture.
>
> Upon feeling the..  Ghosts upon hi ssensors, Wheelie stayed quiet.  He did
> not know what they were, but he felt the chill upon ihs spark regardless.
> Yet he could not see them, out of the corner of his optics or on any sort of
> sensor.  Yet there was something there, if even nothing more than his own
> unease.
>
> At the very least, hopefully there would be SOMETHING ahead in th structure
> to give him a goal..  Or, otehrwise if he was being pursued, to give him a
> bit of cover he could use to shield himself if eh came under attack!

<NEW>

If a building could be said to be transmetal this one was it - Part
earth and stone and part metal it looked much like a pyramid built out
of stone and metal rising up at least 30 or 40 feet into the air.
However instead of meeting at a point the last bit is a bit squared
off, not quite the egyptian pyrmaid that might come to mind of a
human, had they been approaching as WHEELIE was.

The structure was surrounded by a stone wall with an open gate, one
that the path WHEELIE was on was going towards. As he approached he
could see a single figure standing at the gate as if waiting for him.

The figure is in the photos section of the club site:
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/nbwrpg/photos/album/306782857/pic/1443963172/view

(TAG)

Preston
